name: Chef John's Smothered Pork Chops
author: Chef John
summary: You know that when a recipe has 'smothered' in the name, it's going to be easy. It's a beautiful combination of dark, rich onion gravy covering pan-fried pork chops. Serve over hot cooked rice.
ingredients: 4  large bone-in pork chops, about 1 inch thick
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Sprinkle pork chops with poultry seasoning, salt, and black pepper on both sides
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat; brown pork chops well on both sides, about 5 minutes per side
Discard excess grease from pan and melt butter in the same skillet
Reduce heat to medium and stir onion in the hot skillet with a pinch of salt until onion is very browned and caramelized, about 15 minutes
Stir in garlic and cook for 1 minute; stir in flour and cook for 2 minutes
Pour chicken broth into skillet and stir, dissolving browned bits of food in the bottom of the skillet
Pour juices that have accumulated on plate containing pork chops into the sauce
Bring sauce to a simmer, reduce heat to low, and cook until onions begin to break down and sauce is thickened, 15 to 20 minutes
Place pork chops into sauce, spooning sauce over meat to coat
Turn heat to low and simmer until chops are tender and cooked through, about 10 minutes
Adjust levels of salt and pepper and serve chops with gravy on top
